greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f. A(x) satisfies: A(x)^2 = 1/AGM(1, 1 - 8*x/A(x)^2 ).
comment: See A060691 for the expansion of AGM(1,1-8x), where AGM denotes the arithmetic-geometric mean.
formula: Quadrasections are A158212(n) = A158122(4n) and A158213 = A158122(4n+1);
let B(x), C(x), be the g.f.s of A158212 and A158213, respectively,
example: G.f. of quadrasection A158213 is C(x) = 2/B(x):
where g.f. A(x) = B(x^4) + x*C(x^4) = B(x^4) + 2*x/B(x^4). (End)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Mar 13 2009
